page.title: 01North Seil Island
page.content:
North Seil Island & Adjoining Mainland
This area comprises the isle of Seil including the village of Clachan Seil, the estate of Ardencaple anf farms of Oban Seil, Ardshellach and Barnyarry. Seil is adjoined to the mainland by the Bridge over the Atlantic, so termed for it is the only bridge which spans the Atlantic ocean - although the Seil sound is hardly the widest or deepest point! By the bridge, Tigh an Truish inn - Gaelic for house of trousers was the changing place for islanders to leave their kilts when the wearing of tartan was banned The village wo Clachan Seil runs along the road overlooking Seil Sound. Most of the villagers work in Oban, 16 miles to north or with the Forestry Commission or fishing.
